Comment: I am sorry to hear that.  I do read that there is still a fair amount of US tourism to Canada.  Some of my fellow Americans are initially concerned about being "tarred and feathered" if they cross into Canada - guilt by association, but are reporting very positive experiences.    I subscribe to the National Park sub and there are many Americans posting currently about touring parks with the better known Canadian national parks often in the conversation.  What I think may be a big concern is failing personal finances here.  Millions of Americans are on the verge of bankruptcy - the wealth distribution in America is far more unequal than Canada which is why Canadians were revered as tourists - they spent whereas American tourists typically did not to the same degree.  We are also now getting some reports of our customs and border service running intimidation patrols on the personal custom lanes at crossing points into Canada.  It seemingly is an effort to intimidate Americans into staying in America by the Trump admin.  I have done hundreds of crossings over decades into Canada (if not thousands by now) to visit family and never once saw a CBP officer anywhere other than in the commercial lanes (inspecting trucks is a routine part of their daily work).  But in the last few days there are multiple reports of CBP in the personal traffic lanes.  Scary.
